reviews.title: Poor quality food and staff and long waiting time
reviews.text: After ordering was taken I was told after 15 minutes that the dish I ordered was no longer there. Ordered something else. After an hour of waiting asked where our food went. A cranky waiter said it was coming. Alkes together 5 quarters of an hour o food have to wait. Had to ask where the pasta and grilled vegetables that came with the main course were. Turned out to be a cold paste and grilled vegetables were grilled days before and were limp, cold and dehydrated. We were even more rude to our complaints. Weren't ovigens the only guests who had complaints. Table next to us also complained about the long Waiting time and very poor quality. Asked for the bill and had to pay at the bar, while other guests at the table could enter. Tejrning met and again complained about quality food and staff.

reviews.title: DO NOT GO HERE! (rude behavior)
reviews.text:
It's Friday night and the Pleinfeesten in Epe are happening. Unreachable by phone for reservation (after ringing "unreachable" several times). Then I drove over.

- Do you have a table for 2 ?
* The nice lady says Yes, but tells you that the kitchen is closed.
- What does this mean? it's 20:10 🙂
* Is just like that.
- Well, then we'll go. It's weird, though.
* Another nice lady still interferes in a non-unfriendly way, but of course it does not help.
* When we walk out, a curling ball suddenly comes after us, shouting something like "do you have a problem or something?! He shouts that way too loudly in the middle of the crowded terrace.
- Yes, the problem is that the kitchen is already closed. Little early.
* Hip-hop kid yells a little louder "gah you lekkug huiskokeh joh!".
- I can hip-hop too so I shout back a little louder "are you all hot? behave yourself, man."
* Hey, if you can't stand booze you shouldn't drink heh!
- Sssooo !! you dare. And what does that tell you I had a drink?
* Do you always behave like this?
- Yes, I do. YOU TOO?
- The audience became a real audience, so I asked him "have you been working here long man?"
* 3 years.
- 3 years, that doesn't seem possible to me.
* No, 10 years - 10 years, man.
- It's about time you went to work somewhere else !!

Even though I had a great time with it, and I hope the audience did, I do apologize to that same audience for the behavior of this curly head, which-I-don't-know-where came from. Inside I didn't see him - he just came after me out of nowhere. And if I had been angry with the staff... but I hadn't.

While walking away I got a look of understanding from the second lady who had also come out. There was a "sorry that's how it goes here." Respect for this lady(s).

Folks, don't come here. This club doesn't deserve to exist. This can't be like this.

reviews.title: Fantastico
reviews.text:
Welcoming reception and a nice menu with lots of choice of Italian cuisine. The prices are reasonable! 
We love to come back.

reviews.title: Never again!
reviews.text:
Meal was meagre.
Service uninterested.
Owner snaps at the staff. 

We're not coming back.

Just once along a pizzeria in epe was a special evening , great good food with his 3s , and everything was super tasty with fine desserts . Service attentive and friendly. Price good. 

Greetings Alphen aan den rijn .

reviews.title: Top pizzas! nice terrace!
reviews.text: "The most delicious pizzas in the wider area! A cozy terrace and a real Italian who cooks as he should — authentic and with passion!"

reviews.title: Lasagna bruciato or lasagna acquose
reviews.text: Saturday 29 March we had dinner at Casa Sarda in Epe. Cozy restaurant but as with any restaurant nowadays it is about seating per square meter. My wife had previously eaten here with friends with a very good eating experience. On recommendation a lasagna taken and this was not a good choice turned out afterwards. The lasagna was served turned out to be full of hard dough pieces which had been burned. Do not complain so quickly but at the behest of my wife ministry called. After reviewing the kitchen, my complaint was justified, would you like something else? I'll have a lasagna anyway! After about fifteen minutes and insisting that we were still waiting for the lasagna, a boiling lasagna came to my table. Way too much sauce/moisture, a kind of lasagna mush. My wife indicated that there had to be another cook in the kitchen, because the quality difference was so big. Bar employee asked if my lasagna was good now, gave my opinion but apparently he didn't want to do anything with this anymore. At home we make better lasagna! After eating the lasagna soup, my stomach was also upset, abdominal pain and a disrupted stomach intestinal tract. Micro-biologically it must have been killed, after all the lasagna boiled, nowadays you don't know what happens in those kitchens nowadays. Disappointing unfortunately, it is expensive, crammed together, portions are getting smaller, if the food is also of poor quality, was no customer loyalty.

reviews.title: Delicious Italian pizzas
reviews.text: Best pizza in the Veluwe region. Write a review because I rank by how low it is, is really far from the best pizza I have had in the Netherlands.

reviews.title: Friendly, cozy and delicious pizzas
reviews.text: Full tent on a Thursday night, very friendly staff and delicious pizzas. We accidentally ordered the wrong pizza and asked if we could still taste the Sardinian sausage, which we had actually wanted. No problem, said the waitress, and arrived moments later with a dish of that sausage. Very good, that Sardinian sausage. And the rest, too. Highly recommended with a great value for money. The bowl of sausage wasn't even on the bill. Very kind.

reviews.title: Fairly good food
reviews.text:
Very bad contact especially, first fobbed off with no reservation possible, after a lot of calls suddenly yes
Unreachable, with later comment we are on vacation, not to be seen if you googled on tel nr and on tel, dish picked out on the internet was no longer orderable vd winter map, it was July? And then adjust the card immediately aam,little effort
Furthermore nice pizzas but scoop ice cream for 8.50 with 2 strawberries with dessert

reviews.title: Delicious Italian food
reviews.text: Super tasty Italian food! Enough choice and a nice atmosphere!! There is also a cozy terrace. House wine is also tasty.

reviews.title: Nice thing!
reviews.text:
The umpteenth time we ate here.
The kitchen is always good, the service attentive, friendly and accommodating...even when it is busy.
Carpaccio- Insalata Caprese- Antpasto di Terra - Tagliolini al Salmone.
A party every time!

Grazie!

reviews.title: Best Italian restaurant in Gelderland
reviews.text: Nice restaurant, I was here during COViD first break,the owner Roberto is a nice person always available, in this place I've eaten the best spaghetti with vongole in the Netherlands. I want to remark the cook Michele professionally

reviews.title: Very good and tasty meal !
reviews.text:
Hello,

I have lived in EPE in 2019 and returned here after some years to remember the past.
Its a lovely town with with nice cafes and shops.I wanted to eat in CASA SARDA,and it had to be today !!! I was coming from making 35 km on my sport bycicle from Zwolle to Epe and stopped here.As a big fan of the italian kitchen i was pleasanty suprised.
Excelent Antipasto for a starter and Sardinian Pasta for main to finish with a Lekker Tiramisu and Limoncello.I will return for sure.
As been involved in Horeca ( my father had several restaurants in Bulgaria and Spain i like to see how the whole restaurant works and what experience trasmit me.
And this was positive.
The portions were big and satisfactory and well presented.
They waited me to finish my starter,something i always did in my carrer as a waiter as well.As i worked with Chef from Napoli i have learned to savour the italian taste to the fullest and dont imagine my life without having something italian at least once a week )
My friend joined me later at the end of my meal,but he wasnt hungry,so we agreed to come in this restaurant again.I also liked the music - Il Padrino 
So well done CASA SARDA ! Thank u very much for making my day better even though i have eaten a bit too much,next time no starter )

Ciao

reviews.title: Great Meal
reviews.text: We went to Casa Sarda for my grandfather’s 80th birthday party while staying in a bungalow park nearby. Great atmosphere, friendly staff and an excellent meal. A nice amount of starters, great meat, pasta and pizza mains as well as nice desserts and that with some great wine. Italian the way an Italian is supposed to be. Deserves much better rating in TripAdvisor.

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

articleContent.title: How to eat your way through Greenville, SC

seoInfo.metaDescription: For those who plan their meals before booking a plane ticket, listen up: There is a place where you can immerse yourself in the dining cultures of 34 countries across five continents without leaving a single city limit. Greenville, South Carolina is much more than a restaurant hub—it has enough festivals, food tours, and dinner views to fuel a lifetime of trips. All of this in mind, it’s no wonder the region will be featured on Season 23 of Bravo’s Top Chef, and host the inaugural Michelin Guide American South Ceremony.

randomContentList.sponsorDisplayName: Fort Myers – Islands, Beaches and Neighborhoods

tripContent.title: Experience vibrant art and culture in Fort Myers
tripContent.description: There’s so much more to soak up than the sun in and around Fort Myers. This itinerary is designed for art-lovers, who can take in the visual and performing arts scene, learn about the area’s fascinating history, and go for a scenic stroll to enjoy neighborhood murals and outdoor art installations.

articleContent.title: Where the Island of Hawaii’s top chefs go on their days off

seoInfo.metaDescription: Two chefs on their go-to Big Island spots for “grinds” and gourmet fare.

articleContent.title: 11 accessible trails to hike along the Blue Ridge Parkway

seoInfo.metaDescription: From scenic drives to strenuous climbs, there’s something for everyone.

articleContent.title: How to walk the Las Vegas Strip at night

seoInfo.metaDescription: Whenever I’m in Las Vegas my absolute favorite pastime is walking the Strip at night. That’s when the city’s massive casino resorts are at their most mesmerizing, wowing even a repeat visitor like me with synchronized fountains and incredible replicas of world-famous landmarks made all the more dazzling by a gazillion neon and LED lights. While this could border on Disneyesque, the Strip’s edgy, anything-goes vibe makes it the ideal spot to get swept up in the city’s notorious sensory overload—which, as a New Yorker, I can relate to.

tripContent.title: Orlando (Francis' Version)
tripContent.description: "The way I do Orlando is magical, memorable, and insanely mesmirizing! From bookstores to living out fantasy worlds in real life, my version of Orlando leaves you inspired and feeling welcomed and safe." – Francis

seoInfo.metaDescription: Here's how to make the most of three days in Porto, from the cobblestone streets of Ribeira to the hipster flea markets of Cedofeita.

articleContent.title: Your Ultimate Melbourne Summer with AO Travel & Experiences Packages

seoInfo.metaDescription: It’s game, set, and a winning Melbourne adventure for tennis fans heading to the Australian Open in January. With AO Travel & Experiences - the official travel provider of the AO - you’ll make the most of every break in play, stepping beyond the court to discover everything the vibrant city of Melbourne has to offer.
How to make the most of three days in Melbourne from the best coffee spots and restaurants to iconic sights and art museums.
